ARTICLE.TITLE: TN: Hindu Sena protests against Valentine's Day in Coimbatore, burn, tear greeting cards
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Hindu Sena, a right-wing group, has taken it upon itself to be the moral police this Valentine's Day as some of its members protested against the celebration of the day in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu on Monday.

Protesting against it, the members of the Hindu Sena also ripped Valentine's Day cards and set them on fire.

The protest was conducted outside the Coimbatore district collector's office.

Some members of the Hindu Sena gathered outside the district collector's office to protest against the day.

They shouted slogans against the Valentine's Day and also demanded the district collector to take necessary measures on February 14.

In 2018, the Shakti Sena and the Bharat Sena, that identify themselves as Hindu groups, had decided to do the moral policing in Coimbatore ahead of the Valentine's Day.

While the Shakti Sena held a demonstration in the city tearing cards before the public, the Bharat Sena protested outside the district collector's office.

The Bharat Sena had also demanded appropriate action against the couples who roam around in public and celebrate Valentine's Day.
